title: Use recipes
code: library(metasurvey) #> Welcome to: metasurvey version 0.0.2 #> use_copy: TRUE #> metasurvey.engine: data.table #> metasurvey.api.key: ******** #> metasurvey.user: public #> metasurvey.lazy_processing: TRUE recetas_mercado_trabajo <- get_recipe(   "ech",   "2022",   topic = "ingreso" ) #> The API returned 1 recipes

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mauro Loprete. Author, maintainer. Natalia da Silva. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Loprete M, da Silva N (2025). metasurvey: Survey Processing Meta-Programming. R package version 0.0.2, https://github.com/metasurveyr/metasurvey.
code: @Manual{,   title = {metasurvey: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming},   author = {Mauro Loprete and Natalia {da Silva}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://github.com/metasurveyr/metasurvey}, }

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
text: package provides set functions facilitate analysis survey sampling data using meta-programming techniques. package can create reproducible analysis pipelines, easily generate reports tables. package designed work survey package, particularly useful complex survey designs. Adittionally, package provides set functions facilitate variance estimation complex survey designs, facilitate analysis complex survey designs using survey package. package currently development, yet available CRAN. can install development version package using devtools package.

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
text: can install released version metasurvey CRAN : development version Github :

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(metasurvey)  # Load the data  eph2022_3 <- load_survey(   path = load_survey_example("eph2022_3.csv"),   svy_type = "eph",   svy_edition = "2022_3",   svy_weight = "PONDERA" ) %>%   metasurvey::step_recode(     "pea",     ESTADO %in% 1:2 ~ 1,     .default = 0   ) %>%   metasurvey::step_recode(     "pet",     ESTADO != 4 ~ 1,     .default = 0   ) %>%   metasurvey::step_recode(     "po",     ESTADO == 1 ~ 1,     .default = 0   ) %>%   metasurvey::step_recode(     "pd",     ESTADO == 2 ~ 1,     .default = 0   )

code: add_replicate(   weight,   replicate_pattern,   replicate_path = NULL,   replicate_id = NULL,   replicate_type )

text: weight Weight replicate_pattern Replicate pattern replicate_path Replicate file replicate_id Replicate ID replicate_type Replicate type

title: Read panel survey files from different formats and create a RotativePanelSurvey object — load_panel_survey
text: path_implantation Survey implantation path, file can different formats, csv, xtsx, dta, sav rds path_follow_up Path needed files survey valid files also can character vector path files. svy_type String survey type, supported types; "ech" (Encuensta Continua de Hogares, Uruguay), "eph" ( Encuesta Permanente de Hogares, Argentina), "eai" (Encuesta de Actividades de Innovación, Uruguay) svy_weight_implantation List survey implantation weights information specifing periodicity  name weight variable. Recomended use helper function add_weight(). svy_weight_follow_up List survey follow_up weights information specifing periodicity  name weight variable. Recomended use helper function add_weight(). ... arguments passed  load_panel_survey

title: Read panel survey files from different formats and create a RotativePanelSurvey object — load_panel_survey
Read panel survey files from different formats and create a RotativePanelSurvey object — load_panel_survey
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # example code path_dir <- here::here("example-data", "ech", "ech_2023") ech_2023 <- load_panel_survey(  path_implantation = file.path(    path_dir,    "ECH_implantacion_2023.csv"  ),  path_follow_up = file.path(    path_dir,    "seguimiento"  ),  svy_type = "ECH_2023",  svy_weight_implantation = add_weight(    annual = "W_ANO"  ),  svy_weight_follow_up = add_weight(    monthly = add_replicate(      "W",      replicate_path = file.path(        path_dir,        c(          "Pesos replicados Bootstrap mensuales enero_junio 2023",          "Pesos replicados Bootstrap mensuales julio_diciembre 2023"        ),        c(          "Pesos replicados mensuales enero_junio 2023",          "Pesos replicados mensuales Julio_diciembre 2023"        )      ),      replicate_id = c("ID" = "ID"),      replicate_pattern = "wr[0-9]+",      replicate_type = "bootstrap"    )  ) ) } # }

what: Read survey files from different formats and create a Survey object — load_survey
title: Read survey files from different formats and create a Survey object — load_survey
text: Read survey files different formats create Survey object

title: Read survey files from different formats and create a Survey object — load_survey
code: load_survey(   path = NULL,   svy_type = NULL,   svy_edition = NULL,   svy_weight = NULL,   svy_psu = NULL,   ...,   bake = FALSE,   recipes = NULL )

title: Read survey files from different formats and create a Survey object — load_survey
text: path Survey file path, file can different formats, csv, xtsx, dta, sav rds svy_type String survey type, supported types; "ech" (Encuensta Continua de Hogares, Uruguay), "eph" ( Encuesta Permanente de Hogares, Argentina), "eai" (Encuesta de Actividades de Innovación, Uruguay) svy_edition String survey edition information, support different time patterns: "YYYYMM"/"MMYYYY" (year- month), "YYYY" (year),  ("YYYY-YYYY") date range svy_weight List survey weight information specifing periodicity  name weight variable. Recomended use helper function add_weight(). svy_psu Primary sampling unit ... arguments passed  load_survey bake Logical inicating recipes processed data loaded. recipes object, using helper function get_recipes()

title: Read survey files from different formats and create a Survey object — load_survey
Read survey files from different formats and create a Survey object — load_survey
code: ech_2022 <- load_survey( metasurvey::load_survey_example(  "ech",  "ech_2022" ), svy_edition = "2022", svy_type = "ech", svy_weight = add_weight(annual = "w_ano"), recipes = get_recipe(  "ech",  "2022" ) ) #> The API returned 1 recipes #> Loading required package: data.table

title: Load survey example — load_survey_example
text: svy_type Survey type svy_edition Survey edition

text: svy Survey object RotativePanelSurvey ... <data-masking> Name-value pairs. name gives name column output. value can : vector length 1, recycled correct length. vector length current group (whole data frame ungrouped). NULL, remove column. data frame tibble, create multiple columns output. .Strig group variable compute use_copy Logical, FALSE adds new variables reference object like data.table, TRUE adds new variables new object comment String add metadata information stap compute compatible Markdown syntax .level String use Rotative_Panel_survey object indicating data use, level options available;  'implantation' 'follow-'

Step recode — step_recode
code: step_recode(   svy = survey_empty(),   new_var,   ...,   .default = NA_character_,   .name_step = NULL,   ordered = FALSE,   use_copy = use_copy_default(),   comment = "Recode step",   .to_factor = FALSE,   .level = "auto" )

title: Step recode — step_recode
text: svy Survey object RotativePanelSurvey new_var Character string new variable create ... sequence two-sided formulas. left hand side (LHS) determines values match case. right hand side (RHS) provides replacement value. LHS inputs must evaluate logical vectors. RHS inputs coerced common type.inputs recycled common size. said, encourage LHS inputs size. Recycling mainly useful RHS inputs, might supply size 1 input recycled size LHS inputs. .default Value replace match found .name_step Character name step identify step survey object, name step provided created automatically ordered Logical, TRUE new variable ordered use_copy Logical, FALSE adds new variables reference object like data.table, TRUE adds new variables new object comment String add metadata information stap compute compatible Markdown syntax .to_factor Logical, TRUE new variable converted factor .level String use Rotative_Panel_survey object indicating data use, level options available;  'implantation' 'follow-'
